intro: Erigeron lanceolatus var. lorentzianus, commonly known as the Lorentzian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. The leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
